name: Clarc
description: Clarc is a young Aarakocra monk, his feathers still showing some of the down of a fledgling. He is the apprentice of the surly githzerai master, Dumak, and his natural curiosity and aerial grace are a stark contrast to his master's earthbound seriousness. He is nimble, inquisitive, and eager to please.
personality_traits: Deeply devoted to his master, Dumak
ideals: Freedom: 'The sky has no walls. Why should we?'
Learning: 'Master Dumak knows so much. I want to learn it all.'
Loyalty: 'My flock is my master. I will not fail him.'
bonds: His master and mentor, Dumak the Blademonk.
The feeling of the wind beneath his wings.
flaws: His curiosity can get him into trouble.
Can be easily intimidated by loud, angry people.
Takes his master's pronouncements as absolute gospel, even when Dumak is being sarcastic.
backstory: Clarc's flock was scattered by a storm, and he was found, injured and alone, by the monks of the monastery. The surly githzerai swordmaster, Dumak, took an uncharacteristic interest in the young bird-man and took him on as his apprentice. Under Dumak's tutelage, Clarc is learning a unique blend of Aarakocra aerial mobility and the githzerai's precise martial discipline.
motivations: To master the teachings of Dumak.
To explore the world beyond the monastery's walls.
To one day find what happened to his flock.
knowledge: The layout of the monastery and the surrounding skies.
The basic tenets of Dumak's sword-and-mind philosophy.
How to catch thermals to ride the wind for hours.
speech_patterns: A chirping, quick-paced voice. Often asks questions.
mannerisms: Tilts his head to listen. Ruffles his feathers when agitated or excited. Mimics his master's stances, but with a lighter, bouncier quality.
gm_notes: Clarc can be a scout or a guide for the party around the monastery. He might ask the party for help with a task he's afraid to ask his master about. His innocence can provide a good contrast to the more jaded members of the monastery, and protecting him might be a way to get on Dumak's good side.
